at harvey mudd college (hmc) & the claremont colleges (5cs)

class of 2023 president (hmc)

october 2019 - present

I represent the Harvey Mudd College Class of 2023 and am a member of the Associated Students of Harvey Mudd College (ASHMC), the student government at HMC. My responsibilities and goals include attending weekly ASHMC Senate meetings to make decisions benefitting the HMC student body, organizing events for class unity, helping integrate the Class of 2023 into the Claremont community, and fostering relationships with professors.

women in computer science officer (5c)

september 2019 - present

As a member of the Claremont colleges' Women in Computer Science student organization's leadership team, I help female students at the 5Cs find opportunities in computer science. This involves interfacing with companies and organizing events. For example, I planned and organized a highly successful HackerRank and Technical Interview Workshop for the group to learn more about the technical internship and job hiring process and how to approach coding challenges and technical interviews. 40 students attended.

study cloud website front-end team (hmc)

september 2019 - present

I am a front-end developer for the Study Cloud website team at HMC. We are a student-run club that is creating a website called Study Cloud to allow students to share study materials. For Study Cloud, I work mainly with HTML, CSS, and Sass. I am currently working on making the website more aesthetically pleasing, which is a great project for me given my interest in design.

Learn more about my work for Study Cloud in my technical projects tab.

society of women engineers (hmc)

september 2019 - present

I am a member of the Society of Women Engineers (SWE) at HMC. We advocate for female students looking to major and find careers in technical fields like engineering and computer science. I actively attend SWE events, like sessions with companies, workshops, socials, and dinners, so that I can get to know other passionate female tech students at HMC and find new opportunities for me to grow as an engineer.

the muddraker newspaper (hmc)

september 2019 - present

I'm heavily involved in student journalism at the Claremont colleges. I write, edit, design, and take photos for HMC's The Muddraker newspaper. I love being able to capture stories in my community.

And I've always been passionate about graphic design and photography. Take a look at my design and photography tabs to see some of my work for The Muddraker and other organizations.

One of my favorite stories to date was one that I wrote about an 81-year-old auditor in my CS 5 Gold class. I met him at a tutoring sessions for that introductory CS class, and through interviews and CS lectures, I got to know him. He has an incredible life story and many lessons to share with the world, and I'm glad that I was able to have the opportunity to tell his story.

Visit The Muddraker online here.

the student life newspaper (5c)

september 2019 - present

I am an Opinions Writer for The Student Life newspaper of all seven Claremont Colleges. I love writing for opinions because it allows me to shed light on important issues in my community and work toward improving student life and addressing problems that my should be resolved.

For instance, after I wrote an article about the benefits of multi-factor authentication, Scripps College began implementing a multi-factor authentication system for students and faculty, and cited my article. I have also written about printing issues, campus safety, and mental health and student wellbeing at HMC.

Read my articles for The Student Life here.

tour guide (hmc)

january 2020 - present

I am a tour guide for the HMC Office of Admissions. I lead weekly tours of my college to introduce prospective students to HMC and inform visitors about HMC's unique status as a liberal arts college specializing in STEM, as well as our incredible professors, engaging and challenging courses, and collaborative and supportive community.

I love HMC, and I enjoy being a tour guide because I can provide visitors with more insight into the unique and amazing HMC I know. In general, I deeply enjoy talking to others and getting to know people. I extend my enthusiasm for meeting new people to my job as a tour guide, making visitors feel welcome and comfortable during their time at Mudd.

It's also a great way to practice the handy skill of walking backward and to get some extra steps in each week!
